page.title: 13THE CHURCH-CAMELS' AREA
page.content: The church plays quite an important part in the community, in that it marries, christens and buries people and provides help and comfort to many who are in need. In this parish, the congregation has diminished during the past 10 years, although special services like Christmas and Easter are still crowded. The vicar has churches at Queen Camel, Marston Magna and West Camel to look after. He visits the school regularly and also the hospital in Yeovil. The churches at West Camel and Queen Camel were built at about the same time in the 14th century. They both have very old rood screens which divide the sacred part of the church from the public part. The bells in Queen Camel church weigh 5\ tons. The wooden lectern base originated in Holyroad House, Scotland.
